analyzed: lha'i bu / de ltar dge slong mi brtson pa'i tshul gyis mngon par brtson pa yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi bden pa sgom pa ni mi lta ba'o //

analyzed: lha'i bu; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad la lta ba ste /

analyzed: bden pa rnams mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis kyang sgom mod kyi /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: and goes from buddha realm to buddha realm.

original: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar gyur cing thabs mkhas pas bden pa rnams la sgom mo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar gyur cing thabs mkhas pas bden pa rnams la sgom mo //
translated: Providing for all beings, he meditates on the truths through skillful means.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine son, it is like this:🔽

original: dper na / sha na'i ras la me tog tsampa ka dang / me tog 'bar shi kas bsgos na de'i dri myur du yal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / sha na'i ras la me tog tsampa ka dang / me tog 'bar shi kas bsgos na de'i dri myur du yal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of gods, if one perfumes a cloth from the Śākala region with campaka flowers or with barhishika flowers, the scent will quickly disappear.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi bden pa la sgom pa ni yun thung bar blta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi bden pa la sgom pa ni yun thung bar blta ste /
translated: Son of gods, in the same way, the cultivation of the truths of the śrāvakas should be seen as short-lived.

original: de myur du mya ngan las 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi dri'ang mi 'byin /
analyzed: de myur du mya ngan las 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi dri'ang mi 'byin /
translated: Having quickly attained nirvāṇa, they do not emit the scent of the Buddha's discipline, learning, samādhi, wisdom, and gnosis.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa'ang spong mi nus so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa'ang spong mi nus so //
translated: They are also unable to abandon the afflictions that are the latent tendencies.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of gods, it is like this:

original: dper na / yul ka shi ka'i gos rin po che la /
analyzed: dper na / yul ka shi ka'i gos rin po che la /
translated: For example, if one perfumes a precious cloth from the Kāśi region

original: mi dang / lha'i spos dang / me tog gi dris bskal pa chen po brgya stong du bsgos na /
analyzed: mi dang / lha'i spos dang / me tog gi dris bskal pa chen po brgya stong du bsgos na /
translated: with the scent of humans and gods and flowers for a hundred thousand great eons,

original: de'i lha'i dri de rtag tu bro zhing /
analyzed: de'i lha'i dri de rtag tu bro zhing /
translated: the scent of that god will always be fragrant.

original: dri gtsang mas lha dang / mi zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: dri gtsang mas lha dang / mi zil gyis gnon to //
translated: With pure scent, the gods surpass humans.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden bsgom pa mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis bskal pa brgya stong grangs @392b med par bsgoms pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden bsgom pa mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis bskal pa brgya stong grangs @392b med par bsgoms pa ni /
translated: “Divine son, in the same way, the bodhisattva great beings meditate on the truth for countless hundreds of thousands of eons in a manner of not meditating.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob kyi bar du bar mdor de yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob kyi bar du bar mdor de yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing /
translated: Until they attain the wisdom of omniscience endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, they do not pass into parinirvāṇa in the interim.

original: 'di lta ste; rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi dri mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shin tu dri zhim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste; rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi dri mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shin tu dri zhim par 'gyur ro //
translated: In other words, they become extremely fragrant in a manner of not apprehending any scent, such as the scent of the wisdom of omniscience endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad kyang spong zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad kyang spong zhing /
translated: They also eliminate all the habitual tendencies of the afflictions in terms of worldly conventions.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyang 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyang 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The worlds of gods, humans, and demigods will gather around them.

original: de nas lha'i bu rab tu zhi ba rnam par dul ba'i dbang phyug gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu rab tu zhi ba rnam par dul ba'i dbang phyug gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the son of the gods Lord of Thoroughly Pacified and Disciplined said this to youthful Manjushri:🔽

original: 'jam dpal / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i tog de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de ci 'dra /🔽'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i tog de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de ci 'dra / 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Then the son of the gods Lord of Thoroughly Pacified and Disciplined asked Mañjuśrī­kumāra­bhūta, “Mañjuśrī, what is the saṅgha of hearers of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Ratna­ketu like?”

original: don dam par na dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: don dam par na dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'ang ma yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “Ultimately, they do not follow faith.

original: gzhan la dad pas 'gro ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la dad pas 'gro ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: They do not follow faith in others.

original: don dam par na rigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na rigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, they do not follow their family.

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyang mi gtong ngo //
translated: Ultimately, they do not abandon the family of the tathāgatas.

original: don dam par na chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, they do not follow the Dharma.

original: don dam par na chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: don dam par na chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Ultimately, they do not apprehend any Dharma.

original: don dam par na brgyad pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na brgyad pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, they are not in the eighth.

original: kun rdzob tu na log pa'i chos @393a *//
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na log pa'i chos @393a *//
translated: Conventionally, they are not in the Dharma of error.

original: brgyad dang yang bral lo //
analyzed: brgyad dang yang bral lo //
translated: and also free from the eighth.

original: don dam par na rgyun du zhugs pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na rgyun du zhugs pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is not a Stream-enterer,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi bden pa na ngan song thams cad las kyang 'das so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi bden pa na ngan song thams cad las kyang 'das so //
translated: but in the conventional sense of the world, he has transcended all evil destinies.

original: don dam par na lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is not a Once-returner,

original: kun rdzob tu na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang 'ong ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang 'ong ngo //
translated: but in the conventional sense, he does return in order to ripen beings.

original: don dam par na phyir mi 'ong ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na phyir mi 'ong ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is not a Non-returner,

original: kun rdzob tu na chos thams cad las 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na chos thams cad las 'ong ba med do //
translated: but in the conventional sense, he does not return from all dharmas.

original: don dam par na dgra bcom pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na dgra bcom pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is not an Arhat,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du na lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bla na med pa'i mchod par 'os pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du na lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bla na med pa'i mchod par 'os pa'ang yin no //
translated: but in the conventional sense of the world, he is worthy of the highest worship of the world with its gods.

original: don dam par na nyan thos kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na nyan thos kyang ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is not a Sravaka,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad las thos pa'ang 'dzin to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad las thos pa'ang 'dzin to //
translated: but in the manner of non-apprehension, he does hear from all the Lord Buddhas.

original: don dam par na 'dod chags dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na 'dod chags dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, he is not free from desire.

original: kun rdzob tu na 'dod chags kyi yongs su gdung bas kyang mi gdung ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na 'dod chags kyi yongs su gdung bas kyang mi gdung ngo //
translated: Conventionally, he is not tormented by the burning of desire.

original: don dam par na zhe sdang dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na zhe sdang dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, he is not free from hatred.

original: kun rdzob tu na zhe sdang gis yongs su gdung bas kyang mi gdung ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na zhe sdang gis yongs su gdung bas kyang mi gdung ngo //
translated: Conventionally, he is not tormented by the burning of hatred.

original: don dam par na gti mug dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na gti mug dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, he is not free from delusion.

original: kun rdzob tu na chos thams cad mun pa mun nag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na chos thams cad mun pa mun nag dang bral ba'o //
translated: Conventionally, he is free from the darkness of all things.

original: don dam par na nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, he is not free from afflictions.

original: kun rdzob tu na sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa gdul ba'i @393b phyir yang brtson no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa gdul ba'i @393b phyir yang brtson no //
translated: Conventionally, he strives to tame the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: don dam par na thog ma nas ma skyes pa nges par zhugs kyang kun rdzob tu na bsams bzhin du srid pa len to //
analyzed: don dam par na thog ma nas ma skyes pa nges par zhugs kyang kun rdzob tu na bsams bzhin du srid pa len to //
translated: Ultimately, he is certain to be unborn from the beginning, but conventionally, he takes on existence as he wishes.

original: kun rdzob tu na 'khor ba'ang yongs su 'dzin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na 'khor ba'ang yongs su 'dzin mod kyi /
translated: Conventionally, he does indeed take up cyclic existence.

original: don dam par na chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gtong ba'ang med do //
analyzed: don dam par na chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gtong ba'ang med do //
translated: Ultimately, there is no appropriation or relinquishment of any dharma.

original: de don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu dran pa dang bral bar mi mthong bas mthong ste /
analyzed: de don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu dran pa dang bral bar mi mthong bas mthong ste /
translated: He sees by not seeing, ultimately, any dharma whatsoever that is free from mindfulness.

original: kun rdzob tu na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang sgom mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang sgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the applications of mindfulness, conventionally.

original: de don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes ma 'gags par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis kyang rab tu shes la /
analyzed: de don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes ma 'gags par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis kyang rab tu shes la /
translated: He knows by not knowing, ultimately, any dharma whatsoever that is free from non-arising and non-cessation.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod par na yang dag par spong ba rnams kyang sgom mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod par na yang dag par spong ba rnams kyang sgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the right efforts, conventionally, in terms of worldly activity.

original: de don dam par na lus dang / sems med pa'ang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden par na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyang sgrub bo //
analyzed: de don dam par na lus dang / sems med pa'ang 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden par na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyang sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the bases of supernatural power, conventionally, in terms of worldly conventional truth, although ultimately there is no body or mind.

original: de don dam par na dbang po thams cad dang bral yang kun rdzob tu na dbang po rnams kyang sgrub bo //
analyzed: de don dam par na dbang po thams cad dang bral yang kun rdzob tu na dbang po rnams kyang sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the faculties, conventionally, although ultimately he is free from all faculties.

original: de don dam par na chos thams cad rab tu dngos po med par mi mthong ba'i tshul gyis mthong yang nga rgyal can dmigs pa can thams cad tshar gcod pa'i phyir mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis stobs kyang sgom mo //
analyzed: de don dam par na chos thams cad rab tu dngos po med par mi mthong ba'i tshul gyis mthong yang nga rgyal can dmigs pa can thams cad tshar gcod pa'i phyir mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis stobs kyang sgom mo //
translated: Although he does not see the ultimate non-substantiality of all things, he cultivates the powers in such a way that he does not cultivate them, in order to destroy all the conceited and objectifying.

original: de don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu dngos po med par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang sgom mo //🔽de don dam par na shin tu dngos po med kyang kun rdzob tu ni @394a *//
analyzed: de don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu dngos po med par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang sgom mo // de don dam par na shin tu dngos po med kyang kun rdzob tu ni @394a *//
translated: He cultivates the factors of enlightenment in such a way that he does not cultivate them, in order to understand the ultimate non-substantiality of all things.

original: sgom pa'i tshul gyis lam yang sgom mo //
analyzed: sgom pa'i tshul gyis lam yang sgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the path in such a way that he does not cultivate it, in order to realize the ultimate non-substantiality of all things, although it is ultimately non-substantial.

original: de don dam par na yang dag pa'i mtha' la zhi gnas ma ron par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de don dam par na yang dag pa'i mtha' la zhi gnas ma ron par sgrub bo //
translated: He cultivates calm abiding in the limit of reality, ultimately.

original: de don dam par na lhag mthong shin tu mi skye bar mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de don dam par na lhag mthong shin tu mi skye bar mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis mthong ngo //
translated: He sees insight in such a way that he does not cultivate it, ultimately, in order that it not arise.

original: de don dam par na ma rig pa zad pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rig pa skyed de /🔽don dam par na zad pa'am /
analyzed: de don dam par na ma rig pa zad pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rig pa skyed de / don dam par na zad pa'am /
translated: In the ultimate truth, he generates the knowledge that is the exhaustion of ignorance, and does not apprehend it.🔽In the ultimate truth, he does not apprehend exhaustion

original: skye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: skye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: or arising.

original: de sha'i mig gi sems can thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyang mthong la de don dam par na ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de sha'i mig gi sems can thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyang mthong la de don dam par na ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
translated: With the fleshly eye, he sees all sentient beings and all buddhafields, and in the ultimate truth, he does not see anything at all.

original: de lha'i mig gis sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong yang don dam par na ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lha'i mig gis sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong yang don dam par na ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
translated: With the divine eye, he sees the deaths, births, and transmigrations of all sentient beings, and in the ultimate truth, he does not see anything at all.

original: de shes rab kyi mig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / g-yo ba rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes kyang don dam par na ci'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi mig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / g-yo ba rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes kyang don dam par na ci'ang mi shes so //
translated: With the eye of wisdom, he knows the mental activities and movements of all sentient beings, and in the ultimate truth, he does not know anything at all.

original: de chos kyi mig gis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong yang don dam par na chos ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de chos kyi mig gis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong yang don dam par na chos ci'ang mi mthong ngo //
translated: With the Dharma eye, he sees all dharmas as they are in reality, and in the ultimate truth, he does not see any dharma at all.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad byed kyang don dam pa na ci'ang mi byed do //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad byed kyang don dam pa na ci'ang mi byed do //
translated: Although he performs all the deeds of a buddha with the eye of a buddha, ultimately he does not do anything at all.

original: de lha'i rna bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis chos bstan pa thos kyang don dam par na ci'ang mi thos so //
analyzed: de lha'i rna bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis chos bstan pa thos kyang don dam par na ci'ang mi thos so //
translated: Although he hears the teachings of all the buddhas, the blessed ones, with the ear of a god, ultimately he does not hear anything at all.

original: de sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems la lha'ang don dam par na @394b ci'ang mi lta'o //
analyzed: de sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems la lha'ang don dam par na @394b ci'ang mi lta'o //
translated: Although he knows the minds of all beings with a single mind, ultimately he does not see anything at all.

original: de rjes su dran pa'i ye shes kyis sngon gyi mtha' yang rjes su dran mod kyi don dam pa na ci'ang mi dran no //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa'i ye shes kyis sngon gyi mtha' yang rjes su dran mod kyi don dam pa na ci'ang mi dran no //
translated: Although he remembers the past with the wisdom of recollection, ultimately he does not remember anything at all.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyi mi khyab par 'gro'ang don dam par na /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyi mi khyab par 'gro'ang don dam par na /
translated: Although he goes to inconceivable buddha realms with his magical power, ultimately

original: 'ong ba'am / 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: 'ong ba'am / 'gro ba med do //
translated: there is no coming or going.

original: de ni zag pa zad kyang don dam par na zad pa'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni zag pa zad kyang don dam par na zad pa'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: Although he has exhausted the defilements, ultimately he is not a person who has exhausted anything.

original: snang yang snang la don dam par na de'i lus yongs su sgrub pa'ang med do //
analyzed: snang yang snang la don dam par na de'i lus yongs su sgrub pa'ang med do //
translated: Although he appears, ultimately there is no attainment of a body.

original: smra'ang smra la don dam pa na yi ger yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: smra'ang smra la don dam pa na yi ger yang mi brjod do //
translated: Even when speaking, ultimately, it is not expressed in words.

original: sems kyang sems la don dam par na sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos su brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyang sems la don dam par na sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos su brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Even when thinking, ultimately, it is not expressed as mind or mental factors.

original: don dam par na gzugs su'ang mi snang la kun rdzob tu skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni brgyan /
analyzed: don dam par na gzugs su'ang mi snang la kun rdzob tu skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni brgyan /
translated: Ultimately, it does not appear as form, but conventionally, it is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: dpe byad bzang pos ni spras /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang pos ni spras /
translated: It is embellished with the eighty minor marks.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni brgyan /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni brgyan /
translated: It is adorned with the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: gzi brjid ni bsnyen par dka'/
analyzed: gzi brjid ni bsnyen par dka'/
translated: Its splendor is difficult to approach.

original: brjod pa ni rnam par bsgrags /
analyzed: brjod pa ni rnam par bsgrags /
translated: Its expressions resound.

original: tshul khrims kyi byug pas ni byugs /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi byug pas ni byugs /
translated: It is anointed with the unguent of discipline.

original: ngan du smra pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa med /
analyzed: ngan du smra pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa med /
translated: It is not defiled by the words of slander.

original: mngon par shes pas ni rnam par rol /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas ni rnam par rol /
translated: It manifests with the superknowledges.

original: thos pas ni rnam par shigs /
analyzed: thos pas ni rnam par shigs /
translated: It is destroyed by learning.🔽It resounds with eloquence.

original: spobs pas ni rab tu sgrog ;kun rdzob tu ni ye shes kyis ni dam par 'phrul /
analyzed: spobs pas ni rab tu sgrog ;kun rdzob tu ni ye shes kyis ni dam par 'phrul /
translated: It manifests as the supreme wisdom of the conventional.

original: ye shes kyi 'od kyis ni mun pa mun nag sel /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od kyis ni mun pa mun nag sel /
translated: The light of wisdom dispels the darkness of ignorance.

original: shes rab kyis ni snang bar byed /🔽mtha' yas par bstan pa ni rtogs @395a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni snang bar byed / mtha' yas par bstan pa ni rtogs @395a *//
translated: Wisdom illuminates.

original: par khong du chud do //
analyzed: par khong du chud do //
translated: The teaching of the infinite is understood through realization.

original: kun rdzob tu ni sems can thams cad kyi ni skyabs /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sems can thams cad kyi ni skyabs /
translated: All sentient beings are protected by the conventional.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni rtag tu gzigs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni rtag tu gzigs /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas always see.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can dmigs pa can thams cad kyis ni mi blta zhing byang chub kyi phyir ni rtag tu blta ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can dmigs pa can thams cad kyis ni mi blta zhing byang chub kyi phyir ni rtag tu blta ba ste /
translated: The Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and all the tirthikas who are focused on objects do not see. They always see for the sake of enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob tu ni bstan pa ni zad mi shes /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni bstan pa ni zad mi shes /
translated: The conventional teaching is inexhaustible.

original: dran pa ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra /
analyzed: dran pa ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra /
translated: Memory is like the ocean.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni ri rab dang mtshungs /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni ri rab dang mtshungs /
translated: Samadhi is like Mount Meru.

original: bzod pa ni sa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bzod pa ni sa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Patience is like the earth.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir dpa' ba'o //
translated: Conventionally, for the sake of dispelling all conceptual thoughts, one is heroic.

original: mi shis pa'i mun pa mun nag sel ba'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi shis pa'i mun pa mun nag sel ba'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: For the sake of dispelling the darkness of misfortune, one is like the sun.

original: rab tu snang ba'i phyir zla ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rab tu snang ba'i phyir zla ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Like the moon, it is very bright.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'du ba'i phyir dbang po dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'du ba'i phyir dbang po dang mtshungs so //
translated: Like the sense faculties, it is the basis of the relative.

original: kun rdzob tu ni sems la dbang byed pa'i phyir tshangs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sems la dbang byed pa'i phyir tshangs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Like Brahmā, it is the master of the mind in the relative.

original: kun rdzob tu ni nam mkha' la dbang byed pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //🔽kun rdzob tu ni thams cad rjes su song yang don dam par ni gang du song ba'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni nam mkha' la dbang byed pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o // kun rdzob tu ni thams cad rjes su song yang don dam par ni gang du song ba'am /
translated: Like the unequalled, it is the master of space in the relative.

original: 'ongs pa'am / 'dug pa med do //
analyzed: 'ongs pa'am / 'dug pa med do //
translated: Although it pervades everything in the relative, ultimately it does not go anywhere, nor does it come from anywhere, nor does it abide anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu ma byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽lha'i bu / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i tog de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu ma byung ba'i phyir ro // lha'i bu / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i tog de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Because ultimately all phenomena are utterly non-arisen.

original: de bas kyang lhag par @395b bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: de bas kyang lhag par @395b bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang yang ldan no //
translated: Devaputra, the saṅgha of hearers of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Ratna­ketu is like that, and it is endowed with even more inconceivable qualities.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa 'di bshad pa na dge slong lnga brgya dang / dge bsnyen lnga brgya dang / lha'i bu lnga stong dmigs pa can de dag thams cad kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa 'di bshad pa na dge slong lnga brgya dang / dge bsnyen lnga brgya dang / lha'i bu lnga stong dmigs pa can de dag thams cad kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta had given this teaching by way of non-apprehension, five hundred monks, five hundred male lay followers, and five thousand divine sons who were all focused on apprehension said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag cag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i tog de'i nyan thos su gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin po che'i tog de'i nyan thos su gyur cig /
translated: may we also become the hearers of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Ratnaketu.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: kye grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag /
translated: “Oh friends,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der dmigs pa can thams cad mi skye'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der dmigs pa can thams cad mi skye'o //
translated: no one who is focused on apprehension will be born in that buddha realm.

original: kye grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag /
translated: Oh friends,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa med pa rnams ni mi skye ba'i tshul gyis der skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa med pa rnams ni mi skye ba'i tshul gyis der skye'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings who are free from apprehension will be born there by way of non-arising.

original: kye grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag /
translated: Oh friends,

original: gal te khyed kyang der 'dod na khyed kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par gyis shig /
analyzed: gal te khyed kyang der 'dod na khyed kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par gyis shig /
translated: If you wish for that, then you should practice the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything.

original: kye grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag /
translated: “O friends,

original: khyed nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: khyed nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: when you practice the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: friends,

original: khyed la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang rnyed par mi dka' na /
analyzed: khyed la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang rnyed par mi dka' na /
translated: it will not be difficult for you to attain omniscient wisdom endowed with all supreme aspects,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: let alone being born in a pure buddha realm.”

original: lha'i bu rab tu zhi ba rnam par dul ba'i dbang phyug gis yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i bu rab tu zhi ba rnam par dul ba'i dbang phyug gis yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The god Lord of Thoroughly Pacified and Disciplined Serenity then said to youthful Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam @396a *// dpal /
analyzed: 'jam @396a *// dpal /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: nyan thos kyi 'dul ba ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'dul ba ni ji lta bu /
translated: what is the Vinaya of the hearers?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is the Vinaya of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,🔽“Friends,

original: lha'i bu / khams gsum gyis skrag pas btul ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / khams gsum gyis skrag pas btul ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: “Divine son, the training of the śrāvakas is to be tamed through fear of the three realms.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad bsags shing sems can thams cad dbugs 'byin pa dang / khams gsum du bsams bzhin du skye bas btul ba ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad bsags shing sems can thams cad dbugs 'byin pa dang / khams gsum du bsams bzhin du skye bas btul ba ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is to be tamed through gathering all the accumulations of roots of virtue, through bringing relief to all sentient beings, and through being born in the three realms in accordance with one’s wishes.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad la sdang ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad la sdang ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the śrāvakas is to be averse to all afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad kyang nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir rjes su btul ba ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir rjes su btul ba ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is to be tamed through eliminating the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: phyogs gcig rig pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig rig pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the śrāvakas is to know one aspect.

original: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rig pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rig pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is to know the infinite worlds in the ten directions.

original: bdud thams cad la btang snyoms pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: bdud thams cad la btang snyoms pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: “The taming of the śrāvakas is to be indifferent to all māras.

original: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i bdud kyi rigs thams cad dkrugs shing /🔽phyir rgol ba thams cad 'joms pa ni kun rdzob tu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul @396b ba'o; ;bdag gi rgyud gsal bar byed pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i bdud kyi rigs thams cad dkrugs shing / phyir rgol ba thams cad 'joms pa ni kun rdzob tu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul @396b ba'o; ;bdag gi rgyud gsal bar byed pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: “The taming of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is to agitate all the māras in the infinite, limitless world systems in the ten directions,🔽and to destroy all adversaries.🔽“The taming of the śrāvakas is to illuminate one’s own mind.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud gsal bar byed cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud gsal bar byed cing /
translated: “The taming of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is to illuminate the minds of all beings,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes snang bar byed pa dang; chos thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba snang bar byed pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes snang bar byed pa dang; chos thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba snang bar byed pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: to illuminate the wisdom of omniscience, and to illuminate the wisdom that sees all phenomena without obscuration.

original: rang gi sems kyis bsags pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis bsags pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: “The taming of the śrāvakas is to accumulate for oneself.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The intention of all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future is, relatively speaking, the training of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: rdo chag pa'i 'phro mi 'byor ba lta bu ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: rdo chag pa'i 'phro mi 'byor ba lta bu ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the śrāvakas is like a piece of stone that cannot be reshaped.

original: gser dang / dngul chag pa'i 'phro 'byor ba lta bu ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul chag pa'i 'phro 'byor ba lta bu ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, relatively speaking, is like a piece of gold or silver that can be reshaped.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the śrāvakas is devoid of all the qualities of the Buddha and skillful means.

original: thabs mkhas pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du bsdu bas bsdus pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du bsdu bas bsdus pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The training of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, relatively speaking, is endowed with great skillful means and all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the śrāvakas is that which is devoid of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the eighteen aspects exclusive to a buddha, and omniscient knowledge.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bsdu bas bsdus pa ni kun @397a *//
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bsdu bas bsdus pa ni kun @397a *//
translated: The Vinaya of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is that which is included in the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the eighteen aspects exclusive to a buddha, and omniscient knowledge.

original: rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: This is the Vinaya of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas in the conventional sense.

original: mes tshig pa las 'bros pa lta bu ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: mes tshig pa las 'bros pa lta bu ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the śrāvakas is like fleeing from a burning house.

original: skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med khang lta bur chos kyi dga' bas dga' ba ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med khang lta bur chos kyi dga' bas dga' ba ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas in the conventional sense is the delight in the joy of the Dharma, like a garden or a palace.

original: bag chags kyi rgyun ma bcad pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi rgyun ma bcad pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the śrāvakas is the uninterrupted stream of latent tendencies.

original: bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas in the conventional sense is the complete destruction of all latent tendencies.

original: lha'i bu / mdor na tshad du gtogs pa tshad kyi chos kyis drangs pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / mdor na tshad du gtogs pa tshad kyi chos kyis drangs pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: Son of the gods, in brief, the Vinaya of the śrāvakas is that which is drawn by the Dharma of limited measure.

original: tshad du gtogs pa ma yin pa tshad med pa'i chos kyis drangs pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: tshad du gtogs pa ma yin pa tshad med pa'i chos kyis drangs pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is, in conventional terms, that which is drawn by the Dharma of immeasurable measure.

original: tshad yod pa'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba thob par byed pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: tshad yod pa'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba thob par byed pa ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Vinaya of the śrāvakas is that which causes the attainment of limited morality, hearing, samādhi, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: tshad yod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshad yod pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not of limited measure.

original: tshad med pa'i yon tan dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i yon tan dang ldan zhing /
translated: It is endowed with immeasurable qualities.🔽 It is the Vinaya of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: tshad med pa'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba thob par byed pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @397b rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba thob par byed pa ni kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @397b rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The attainment of immeasurable morality, learning, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation is the liberation of the bodhisattva mahāsattva in terms of the conventional.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, “Excellent!

original: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'dul ba legs par bshad pa legs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'dul ba legs par bshad pa legs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, you have explained well the training of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in terms of the conventional.

original: legs so // 'jam dpal /
analyzed: legs so // 'jam dpal /
translated: Excellent, Mañjuśrī!

original: yang 'di ltar don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir khyod la dpe bstan to //
analyzed: yang 'di ltar don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir khyod la dpe bstan to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in order to teach this very meaning, I will give you an analogy.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu gnyis shig yod la /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu gnyis shig yod la /
translated: There are two people.

original: de las skyes bu gcig ni ba lang gi rjes kyi bsngags pa smra /
analyzed: de las skyes bu gcig ni ba lang gi rjes kyi bsngags pa smra /
translated: One of them praises the footprint of an ox.

original: skyes bu gcig ni rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa smra na /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig ni rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa smra na /
translated: One person praises the great ocean.

original: 'jam dpal / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think?

original: skyes bu des ba lang gi rjes kyi bsngags pa ji snyed cig brjod nus /
analyzed: skyes bu des ba lang gi rjes kyi bsngags pa ji snyed cig brjod nus /
translated: How many praises of the cow’s footprint can that person utter?

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ba lang gi rjes thams cad kyang chud na /
analyzed: ba lang gi rjes thams cad kyang chud na /
translated: if all the cow’s footprints are exhausted,

original: de'i bsngags pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de'i bsngags pa lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to mention its praises?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du ba lang gi rjes chung ba ltar nyan thos kyi 'dul bar blta'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du ba lang gi rjes chung ba ltar nyan thos kyi 'dul bar blta'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the training of the hearers should be seen as a small cow’s footprint.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think?

original: skyes bu gcig shos des rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ji tsam zhig brjod nus /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig shos des rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ji tsam zhig brjod nus /
translated: How many praises of the great ocean can that other person utter?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ni shin tu mang ste /🔽dpag tu ma mchis /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ni shin tu mang ste / dpag tu ma mchis /
translated: the praises of the great ocean are extremely numerous.🔽They are immeasurable

original: bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: and inconceivable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal @398a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal @398a *//
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa dpag tu med pa ltar kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul bar blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa dpag tu med pa ltar kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul bar blta'o //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s training should be seen as being like the ocean, with its immeasurable praise.

original: de nas bstan pa 'di mi ston pa'i tshul gyis bshad pa na lha'i bu khri nyis stong gis don dam par na ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes nas tshig 'di skad ces kyang smra ste /
analyzed: de nas bstan pa 'di mi ston pa'i tshul gyis bshad pa na lha'i bu khri nyis stong gis don dam par na ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes nas tshig 'di skad ces kyang smra ste /
translated: Then, when this teaching was explained in a way that did not teach anything, twelve thousand gods gave rise to the intention to achieve unsurpassable, perfect awakening, in a way that was ultimately unborn. They said these words:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag cag ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa 'di la mi slob pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
analyzed: bdag cag ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa 'di la mi slob pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
translated: we train in this bodhisattva training in a way that is not training.

original: de nas lha'i bu rab tu zhi ba rnam par dul ba'i dbang phyug gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu rab tu zhi ba rnam par dul ba'i dbang phyug gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the god Lord of Completely Pacified Discipline said this to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: ci / 'jam dpal /🔽khyod nyan thos kyi 'dul ba la bsabs sam /
analyzed: ci / 'jam dpal / khyod nyan thos kyi 'dul ba la bsabs sam /
translated: Mañjuśrī,🔽have you trained in the training of the hearers,

original: 'on te byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba la bslabs /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba la bslabs /
translated: or have you trained in the training of the bodhisattvas?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Divine son, what do you think?

original: rgya mtsho chen por mi shong ba'i chu gang yang yod dam /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por mi shong ba'i chu gang yang yod dam /
translated: Is there any water that the great ocean cannot contain?”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The divine son said:

original: 'jam dpal / rgya mtsho chen por mi shong ba'i rgyu gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rgya mtsho chen por mi shong ba'i rgyu gang yang med do //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there is no cause whatsoever that the great ocean cannot contain.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba ni rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du kun rdzob tu na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dul ba ni rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: “Divine son, in the same way, the training of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is like the great ocean.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The divine son said:

original: 'jam dpal / 'dul ba 'dul ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi @398b don gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'dul ba 'dul ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi @398b don gang yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what is the meaning of the words ‘training’ and ‘disciplined’?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / nyon mongs pa 'dul ba ni kun rdzob tu na 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / nyon mongs pa 'dul ba ni kun rdzob tu na 'dul ba'o //
translated: “Divine son, the disciplining of the afflictions is, in terms of the relative, training.

original: nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa'ang 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa'ang 'dul ba'o //
translated: The thorough understanding of the afflictions is also training.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal / ji ltar na nyon mongs pa 'dul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal / ji ltar na nyon mongs pa 'dul bar 'gyur /
translated: The divine son said:🔽“Mañjuśrī, how are the afflictions disciplined?

original: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa yin /
translated: How is the thorough understanding of the afflictions?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: don dam par na chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes dngos po med pa yin na kun rdzob tu med pa la phyin ci log tu gyur te /🔽med pa la las phyin ci log tu gyur pa de las kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par na chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes dngos po med pa yin na kun rdzob tu med pa la phyin ci log tu gyur te / med pa la las phyin ci log tu gyur pa de las kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Ultimately, all phenomena are unborn, unarisen, and insubstantial. But in terms of the relative, the unborn is distorted.🔽From the distortion of the unborn, there is conceptualization and discursive thought.

original: kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa de las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa de las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: From conceptualization and discursive thought, there is incorrect mental activity.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de las bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de las bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: From incorrect mental activity, there is the superimposition of a self.

original: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa de las lta ba kun nas ldang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa de las lta ba kun nas ldang ba'o //
translated: From the superimposition of a self, there is the arising of views.

original: lta ba kun nas ldang ba de las nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lta ba kun nas ldang ba de las nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of views, the afflictions arise.

original: gang yang / lha'i bu /
analyzed: gang yang / lha'i bu /
translated: “Divine son,

original: don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes ma byung dngos po med par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes pa de ni don dam par na phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par na chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes ma byung dngos po med par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes pa de ni don dam par na phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: ultimately, the non-understanding of all phenomena as utterly unborn, unarisen, and insubstantial is the understanding of the ultimate as distorted.

original: gang don dam par na phyin ci ma log pa de ni rtog pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang don dam par na phyin ci ma log pa de ni rtog pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: That which is ultimately non-erroneous is free from conceptual thought and free from discursive thought.

original: gang rtog pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa de ni tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang rtog pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa de ni tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is free from conceptual thought and free from discursive thought is properly applied.

original: gang tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba de la don dam par na bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa mi 'byung ngo //🔽rang la don dam par @399a *//
analyzed: gang tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba de la don dam par na bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa mi 'byung ngo // rang la don dam par @399a *//
translated: For one who is properly applied, ultimately the reification of self does not occur.

original: na / bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa mi 'byung ba de la lta ba kun nas ldang bar mi 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: na / bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa mi 'byung ba de la lta ba kun nas ldang bar mi 'gyur ba nas /
translated: For one in whom ultimately the reification of self does not occur, the reification of views does not occur.

original: don dam par na mya ngan las 'das par lta ba kun nas ldang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par na mya ngan las 'das par lta ba kun nas ldang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: For one in whom the reification of views does not occur, ultimately the reification of nirvāṇa does not occur.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa la spyod pa de ni nyon mongs pa shin tu rnam par dul bar mi lta ba'i tshul gyis blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa la spyod pa de ni nyon mongs pa shin tu rnam par dul bar mi lta ba'i tshul gyis blta ste /
translated: Thus, one who practices non-arising should view the thorough refinement of afflictions through the method of non-view.

original: lha'i bu / 'di ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Divine son, this is called the thorough refinement of afflictions.

original: lha'i bu / nam nyon mongs pa rnams la snang pa med pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes kyis don dam par na shin tu stong pa dang / shin tu mtshan ma med pa dang / shin tu smon pa med do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / nam nyon mongs pa rnams la snang pa med pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes kyis don dam par na shin tu stong pa dang / shin tu mtshan ma med pa dang / shin tu smon pa med do //
translated: Divine Prince, when one knows the afflictions through the wisdom and gnosis that are free from appearances, then ultimately they are utterly empty, utterly signless, and utterly wishless.

original: don dam par na shin tu ma skyes /
analyzed: don dam par na shin tu ma skyes /
translated: Ultimately, they are utterly unborn,

original: ma byung / dngos po med par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes na /
analyzed: ma byung / dngos po med par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes na /
translated: unoriginated, and nonexistent.

original: lha'i bu / de'i tshe mi shes pa'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de'i tshe mi shes pa'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: Divine Prince, at that time, through knowing in this way, the afflictions are thoroughly known.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine Prince, it is like this:

original: dper na / sprul kha gdug pa'i rig sngags 'don pa des ni sprul kha gdug pa'i gdug pa rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / sprul kha gdug pa'i rig sngags 'don pa des ni sprul kha gdug pa'i gdug pa rab tu zhi bar byed do //
translated: for example, the mantra of the poisonous snake’s mouth pacifies the poison of the poisonous snake’s mouth.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du gang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs rab tu shes pa de'i nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du gang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs rab tu shes pa de'i nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Divine Prince, in the same way, for those who know the family of the afflictions, the afflictions are pacified through the method of utter nonapprehension.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said:🔽“Noble Mañjuśrī, what is the family of the afflictions?”

original: 'jam dpal / nyon mongs pa'i rigs de gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / nyon mongs pa'i rigs de gang yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is the type of affliction?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na chos thams cad ma skyes /
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na chos thams cad ma skyes /
translated: “Divine son, ultimately all phenomena are unborn,

original: ma byung / dngos po med pa la gang kun tu rtog pa de ni @399b nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs so //
analyzed: ma byung / dngos po med pa la gang kun tu rtog pa de ni @399b nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs so //
translated: unoriginated, and unreal. The conceptualization of that is the type of affliction.

original: don dam par na kun tu ma rtog pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mi mongs so //
analyzed: don dam par na kun tu ma rtog pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mi mongs so //
translated: Ultimately, because there is no conceptualization, there is no affliction.

original: lha'i bu / kun nas nyon mongs pas kun gzhi med do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / kun nas nyon mongs pas kun gzhi med do //
translated: Divine son, because there is no affliction, there is no foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi med pas don dam par ni mi gnas so //
analyzed: kun gzhi med pas don dam par ni mi gnas so //
translated: Because there is no foundation consciousness, ultimately there is no abiding.

original: mi gnas pas /
analyzed: mi gnas pas /
translated: Because there is no abiding,

original: don dam par mi 'tshig go /
analyzed: don dam par mi 'tshig go /
translated: ultimately there is no burning.

original: mi 'tshig pas don dam par na nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'tshig pas don dam par na nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because there is no burning, ultimately it is called peace.

original: don dam pa na ji skad smras pa bzhin du ni ma yin te; lha'i bu /
analyzed: don dam pa na ji skad smras pa bzhin du ni ma yin te; lha'i bu /
translated: Ultimately, it is not as it is said. Divine son,

original: kun rdzob tu na 'di ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na 'di ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba'o //
translated: relatively, this is the taming of the afflictions.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said:

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gyur /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how are the afflictions tamed?

original: ci yod pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci yod pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it by something existent?

original: 'on te med pa zhig /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig /
translated: Is it nonexistent?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Divine son, it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam la sprul kha gdug pas zin nas de sdug bsngal gyis gtse ba las yang dug sman btang nas /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam la sprul kha gdug pas zin nas de sdug bsngal gyis gtse ba las yang dug sman btang nas /
translated: For example, a man who is asleep may dream that he is bitten by a poisonous snake. He suffers from the pain. Then, an antidote is applied,

original: de'i gdug pa med par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i gdug pa med par gyur te /
translated: and the poison is neutralized.

original: gdug pa med par gyur pas sdug bsngal yang med par gyur na /
analyzed: gdug pa med par gyur pas sdug bsngal yang med par gyur na /
translated: Because the poison is neutralized, the pain is also neutralized.

original: lha'i bu / de ji snyam du sems /🔽skyes bu de yang dag par zin tam /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de ji snyam du sems / skyes bu de yang dag par zin tam /
translated: Divine son, what do you think?

original: 'on te yang dag pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te yang dag pa ma yin /
translated: Is the man’s experience real or not?”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god replied,

original: 'jam dpal / don dam par na shin tu yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / don dam par na shin tu yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, ultimately, it is not real at all.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / ji ltar dug de med par gyur /
analyzed: lha'i bu / ji ltar dug de med par gyur /
translated: “Divine son, how is the poison neutralized?”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god replied,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar zin pa shin tu mi bden pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar zin pa shin tu mi bden pa de bzhin du /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, just as the experience of being bitten is not real,

original: dug med par gyur pa'ang @400a *//
analyzed: dug med par gyur pa'ang @400a *//
translated: the neutralization of the poison

original: shin tu bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu bden pa ma yin no //
translated: is also not real at all.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,🔽“Divine son, it is the same with the thus-gone ones.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang don dam par mi blta ba'i tshul gyis blta'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang don dam par mi blta ba'i tshul gyis blta'o //
translated: “Divine son, in the same way, all the afflictions of the noble ones are seen in the ultimate, but not in the manner of seeing.

original: lha'i bu / gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “Divine son, you asked, ‘How are the afflictions tamed?’

original: lha'i bu / ji ltar bdag don dam par na bdag med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: lha'i bu / ji ltar bdag don dam par na bdag med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Divine son, just as the self is ultimately selfless,

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na nyon mongs pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na nyon mongs pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: divine son, ultimately the afflictions are not the afflictions.

original: lha'i bu / de ste don dam par na bdag de bzhin nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de ste don dam par na bdag de bzhin nyid yin na ni /
translated: “Divine son, if the self were suchness in the ultimate,

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na nyon mongs pa'ang de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na nyon mongs pa'ang de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: divine son, ultimately the afflictions would also be suchness.

original: lha'i bu / 'di ltar bdag don dam par na bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ltar bdag don dam par na bdag ma yin te /
translated: “Divine son, since the self is not a self in the ultimate,

original: lha'i bu / de bas na nyon mongs pa rnams kyang don dam par na nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bas na nyon mongs pa rnams kyang don dam par na nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
translated: divine son, the afflictions are not afflictions in the ultimate.

original: lha'i bu / de la gang gis don dam par nyon mongs pa 'dul bar dmigs par 'gyur ba ni don dam par na gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de la gang gis don dam par nyon mongs pa 'dul bar dmigs par 'gyur ba ni don dam par na gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Devaputra, in the ultimate sense, there is nothing whatsoever that can be observed as a means of disciplining the afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na shin tu ma byung ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni zhi ba'o //🔽lha'i bu / don dam par na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na shin tu ma byung ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni zhi ba'o // lha'i bu / don dam par na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Devaputra, in the ultimate sense, all phenomena are peace, because they are utterly non-arisen.🔽Devaputra, in the ultimate sense, all phenomena are thoroughly at peace, because they are ungraspable.

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na chos thams cad sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni rab tu zhi @400b ba'o; ;lha'i bu /🔽don dam par na shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na chos thams cad sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni rab tu zhi @400b ba'o; ;lha'i bu / don dam par na shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni mi zad pa'o //
translated: Devaputra, in the ultimate sense, all phenomena are utterly pacified, because all phenomena are beyond reification.🔽Devaputra, in the ultimate sense, all phenomena are inexhaustible, because they are utterly non-arisen.

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na shin tu dngos po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni shin tu ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na shin tu dngos po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni shin tu ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Devaputra, in the ultimate sense, all phenomena are utterly non-arisen, because they are utterly unreal.

analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /

translated: “Divine son, the conventional truth, which is the gateway to all phenomena, is the gateway for all that is to be expressed, expression, knowledge, objects of knowledge, action, conventions, and activity.

analyzed: smra ba dang / smra bar bya ba dang / shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / bya ba dang / tha snyad dang / byed pa thams cad las rnam par log pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The ultimate truth, which is the gateway to all phenomena, is the gateway for the complete reversal of all that is to be expressed, expression, knowledge, objects of knowledge, action, conventions, and activity.

original: yang lha'i bu /
analyzed: yang lha'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, divine son,

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo'o //

original: kun rdzob tu na the tshom ni sgrib pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na the tshom ni sgrib pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na rnam par grol ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na kun tu rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na mi rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i sgo'o //
translated: In the relative, non-conceptualization is the door to the absence of afflictions.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na zhi gnas ni nye bar zhi ba'i sgo'o //
translated: In the relative, śamatha is the door to tranquility.

original: kun rdzob tu na lta bar gyur pa @401a *//
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na lta bar gyur pa @401a *//
translated: In the relative, the views

analyzed: rnams ni nga rgyal gyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na stong pa nyid ni nga rgyal med pa'i sgo'o //
translated: In the relative, emptiness is the door to the absence of pride.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na sdig pa'i grogs po dang sten pa ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: In the relative, associating with bad friends is the door to all the roots of non-virtue.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang sten pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: In the relative, associating with spiritual friends is the door to all the roots of virtue.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na log par lta ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi sgo'o;/

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na yang dag par lta ba ni bde ba thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: In the conventional sense, right view is the door to all happiness.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na ser sna ni dbul ba'i sgo'o //
translated: In the conventional sense, stinginess is the door to poverty.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na sbyin pa ni longs spyod chen po'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na ngang tshul ngan pa ni ngan 'gro thams cad kyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na tshul khrims ni lha dang / mir skye ba thams cad kyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na gnod sems ni byad gzugs ngan pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na bzod pa ni gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo'o //
translated: In the conventional sense, patience is the door to perfect beauty.

original: kun rdzob tu na le lo ni mi rtogs pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na le lo ni mi rtogs pa'i sgo'o //
translated: In the conventional sense, laziness is the door to non-realization.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na brtson 'grus ni rtogs pa'i sgo'o // kun rdzob tu na rnam par rtog pa ni rgod pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na bsam gtan ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i sgo'o //

original: kun rdzob tu na 'chal ba'i shes rab ni khong du ma chud pa'i sgo'o; ;kun rdzob tu na shes rab ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi sgo'o //🔽kun rdzob tu na byams pa ni khong mi khro ba'i sgo'o //

translated: Conventional truth is the gateway to the thirty-seven factors of awakening.🔽“Conventional truth is the gateway to the absence of anger.🔽Conventional truth is the gateway to great compassion.🔽Conventional truth is the gateway to the absence of deceit.

original: kun rdzob tu na snying rje chen po ni lhag @401b ba'i bsam pa'i sgo'o //🔽kun rdzob tu na lhag pa'i bsam pa ni g-yo med pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na snying rje chen po ni lhag @401b ba'i bsam pa'i sgo'o // kun rdzob tu na lhag pa'i bsam pa ni g-yo med pa'i sgo'o //

original: kun rdzob tu na dga' ba ni chos la mos pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na dga' ba ni chos la mos pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na btang snyoms ni nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na yang dag par spong ba rnams ni yang dag pa'i nan tan gyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni lus dang / sems las su rung ba'i sgo'o //
translated: On the relative level, the bases of miraculous powers are the gateway to physical and mental agility.

original: kun rdzob tu na dbang po rnams ni dad pa thob pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na dbang po rnams ni dad pa thob pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na stobs rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad 'joms pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa khong du chud pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni lam ngan pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na sems can smin par bya ba ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na thabs ni gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mya ngan las 'das @402a *//

translated: Devaputra, any bodhisattva mahāsattva who, even in dreams, does not give rise to a mind that is a substance, an essence, or a thing in the ultimate sense, will become well equipoised in the manner of non-apprehension.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab med pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab med pa /
