original: shes rab chen por 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs yod dam /
analyzed: shes rab chen por 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs yod dam /
translated: and still have great wisdom?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / yod do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / yod do //
translated: Devaputra, there is.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu / don dam par na chos thams cad la shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad de btsal na shin tu med cing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / don dam par na chos thams cad la shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad de btsal na shin tu med cing mi dmigs te /
translated: Devaputra, if one analyzes and searches for all phenomena with wisdom in the ultimate sense, they are utterly non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: shes rab de'ang don dam par na shin tu med cing mi dmigs pas na kun rdzob tu shes rab can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab de'ang don dam par na shin tu med cing mi dmigs pas na kun rdzob tu shes rab can zhes bya ste /
translated: That wisdom, in the ultimate sense, is utterly non-existent and non-apprehensible. Therefore, conventionally, one is called a wise one.

original: shes rab de'ang don dam par @409a *//
analyzed: shes rab de'ang don dam par @409a *//
translated: That wisdom, in the ultimate sense,

original: na shin tu ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: na shin tu ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: It is utterly unborn.

original: lha'i bu / rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab med pa ni shes rab chen po can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab med pa ni shes rab chen po can zhes bya'o //
translated: Divine son, for this reason, the bodhisattva great beings who are without wisdom are said to possess great wisdom.

original: shes rab bye brag tu 'phags pa zhes bya'o //🔽shes rab dam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab bye brag tu 'phags pa zhes bya'o // shes rab dam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to have particularly exalted wisdom.🔽They are said to possess sublime wisdom.

original: shes rab gya nom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gya nom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to have sublime wisdom.

original: mi dmigs pa'i shes rab can zhes bya ste; don dam par na ji skad du brjod pa ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i shes rab can zhes bya ste; don dam par na ji skad du brjod pa ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: They are said to have wisdom that is beyond reference, but ultimately, it is not as it is described.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī­kumāra­bhūta, “Excellent!

original: legs so // legs so; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: legs so // legs so; ;'jam dpal /
translated: Excellent, Mañjuśrī!

original: khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bya ba dang / mi bya ba mi bstan pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa ni tshig 'di legs par smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bya ba dang / mi bya ba mi bstan pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa ni tshig 'di legs par smras so //
translated: You have spoken these words well in teaching the bodhisattva great beings what not to do and what to do without teaching them anything.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu bkres pa ltogs pas nyam chung ba mangs pa sla yi /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu bkres pa ltogs pas nyam chung ba mangs pa sla yi /
translated: For example, it is easy for a hungry and weak person to eat food,

original: mi shes pas kha zas dug can zos pa de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pas kha zas dug can zos pa de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not so for one who has eaten poisonous food.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i ser sna can dang / ngan pa'i ngang tshul can dang / gnod sems can dang / le lo can dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes rab med pa sla yi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i ser sna can dang / ngan pa'i ngang tshul can dang / gnod sems can dang / le lo can dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes rab med pa sla yi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, it is easy for a bodhisattva great being who is free of reference points to be stingy, immoral, malicious, lazy, forgetful, and unwise,

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can gyi sems kyi sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / @409b shes rab kyi sbyor ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not so for a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha whose mind is full of reference points to be generous, moral, patient, persevering, concentrated, and wise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pa'i phyir de la kun rdzob tu 'jigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pa'i phyir de la kun rdzob tu 'jigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Because it is contaminated by the poison of reference points, it should be understood as a danger in the conventional sense.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu mtshams bzang gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu mtshams bzang gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the god Bhadra­saṃkramaṇā said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyon mongs pa rnams la 'jigs par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyon mongs pa rnams la 'jigs par mi bgyi'am /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i bu / kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyon mongs pa rnams la 'jigs par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyon mongs pa rnams la 'jigs par bya'o //
translated: “God, conventionally, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should fear the afflictions.

original: de bas kyang nges nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can gyi sems la shin tu 'jigs par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas kyang nges nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can gyi sems la shin tu 'jigs par bya ste /
translated: Even more, they should greatly fear the mind of the hearers and solitary buddhas, which is focused on an object,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: but not so the afflictions.

original: lha'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus gsol pa /
translated: The god said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ci'i slad nas /
analyzed: de ci'i slad nas /
translated: why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i bu / khyod nyid la dri yi /
analyzed: lha'i bu / khyod nyid la dri yi /
translated: “God, I will ask you something in return.

original: khyod kyis ci nus pa de bzhin du lung ston cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis ci nus pa de bzhin du lung ston cig /
translated: You should give an exposition as best you can.

original: lha'i bu / 'di yid la ji snyam /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di yid la ji snyam /

analyzed: skyes bu 'tsho bar 'dod par gyur bas yan lag bcad pa la 'jigs par bya'am /

analyzed: 'on te mgo bcad pa la rab tu 'jigs par bya /
translated: or should he be afraid of having his head cut off?

original: lha'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus gsol pa /
translated: The god said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yan lag bcad pa'i skyes bu ni 'tsho ste /
analyzed: yan lag bcad pa'i skyes bu ni 'tsho ste /
translated: a person whose limb has been cut off can still live.

original: bsod nams 'dod pa bsod nams kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa de ni mtho ris su skye ba'i @410a *//
analyzed: bsod nams 'dod pa bsod nams kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa de ni mtho ris su skye ba'i @410a *//
translated: One who wishes for merit and who takes up and abides in the path of merit will be reborn in the higher realms.

original: rgyur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur gyi /
translated: That will be the cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mgo bcad pa ni 'tsho ba las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: mgo bcad pa ni 'tsho ba las yongs su nyams te /

analyzed: bsod nams 'tshal ba bsod nams kyi lam yang dag par len cing spyod mi nus so //
translated: One who wishes for merit and who takes up and abides in the path of merit will be unable to practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin te /
translated: “God, it is so.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa ni spyod pa nyams kyang sla yi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa ni spyod pa nyams kyang sla yi /
translated: It is easy for a bodhisattva mahāsattva who does not apprehend anything to fall from the practice,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can gyi lta bar lhung ba rnams kyis bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can gyi lta bar lhung ba rnams kyis bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: It is not so difficult for a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha who has fallen into the view of objective reality to have all the qualities of training and purification.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ser sna can ni sla yi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ser sna can ni sla yi /

original: sems can thams cad yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su btang ste /

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'dor ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'dor ba ni de lta ma yin no //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngan pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur pa ni sla yi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngan pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur pa ni sla yi /
translated: It is not so difficult for a bodhisattva great being to become someone with bad moral discipline.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par gyur pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par gyur pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: It is not so difficult to ripen all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dad pas spyod pa'i sa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dad pas spyod pa'i sa la spyod pa /
translated: It is not so difficult for a bodhisattva great being who is practicing the level of practice through faith,

original: mi dmigs pa la mos shing nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa sla yi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la mos shing nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa sla yi /
translated: who is interested in the absence of objective reality, and who is afflicted,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can des par gyur pa thob pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can des par gyur pa thob pa /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so for the bodhisattvas who are without defilement.

original: lha'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus gsol pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mi @410b spyod pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa lags so //
translated: the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas' practice through the method of non-practice is contrary to the entire world.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pas na /
translated: because it is tainted by the poison of objectification,

original: gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can rnams kyi tshul khrims de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngan pa'i ngang tshul lags so //
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can rnams kyi tshul khrims de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngan pa'i ngang tshul lags so //
translated: the morality of those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who have objects is a bad morality for the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: ji tsam du gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can rnams kyi brtson 'grus de ni dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i le lo'i bar du'o //

translated: To the extent that the effort of those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who have objects is tainted by the poison of objectification, it is laziness for the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Devaputra, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / gang mi dbul po'i kha zas de ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dug go /
translated: the food of a poor person is poison for a universal monarch.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dmigs pa can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / brtson 'grus kyi bar du de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngan pa'i ngang tshul dang / le lo'i bar du'o //

translated: In the same way, divine prince, the morality, etc., up to the effort of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are focused on an object, are for the bodhisattva-mahāsattva the immorality, etc., up to the laziness that are focused on an object.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dug gi skyon chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are tainted by the poison of an object.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine prince, it is like this:

original: dper na / gang bdag nyid bsgrubs pa'i las byed pa'i skyes bu'i nor des grong khyer gyi skye bo thams cad bde bar sbyor mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na / gang bdag nyid bsgrubs pa'i las byed pa'i skyes bu'i nor des grong khyer gyi skye bo thams cad bde bar sbyor mi nus so //

translated: Divine prince, in the same way, the poor attitude, the inferior attitude, and the attitude focused on an object of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas cannot provide happiness for all sentient beings.

original: lha'i bu; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu; 'di lta ste /
translated: “Divine son, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / nor chen po / longs spyod chen po /
translated: For example, a great merchant,🔽a great lord of wealth,

analyzed: gtong pa dang ldan pa /

original: byams pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: byams pa la gnas pa /
translated: one who abides in love,

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: one who possesses great compassion,

original: ded dpon chen po ni /
analyzed: ded dpon chen po ni /
translated: a great captain

analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i bde bar byed pa la zhugs pa'i nor des grangs med dpag tu med pa'i sems can bde bar byed do //

analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa /

analyzed: mi gzhog pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang rab tu 'god do //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Mahākāśyapa said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

analyzed: nyan thos kyis 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams mngon sum du bgyis la /
translated: the hearers have actualized uncompounded dharmas.

original: bcom ldan @411b 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan @411b 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dus byas su gtogs pa lags na /
